topic.shortdesc: Create a backup repository for your data before you start a backup.

section.title: Description
section.p: The create command requires a path to the location where your backup repository will be created as well as a name for the repository. Optional parameters for this command can be used to customize the backup configuration. By default, the created backup configuration will back up all buckets and all data, indexes, and bucket level configuration from your cluster.

section.title: Options
section.p:
The following are the command options:
create options
Option Description
--dir /[directory name] Name of the backup directory.
--name=REPOSITORY-NAME Create the named backup repository.
--include-buckets=BUCKET-NAME Back up data only from the named bucket.
--disable-bucket-config Back up
--disable views Back up all data, GSI indexes, and full text indexes except views. By defult, all data is backed up (GSI indexes, full text indexes) except from the one that is disabled.

section.title: Examples
section.p: To create a backup repository named travel in the /tmp/backups folder with the default configuration: ./backup create --dir /tmp/backups --name=travel

To create a backup repository named travel in the /tmp/backups folder with a configuration that backs up all data, indexes, and bucket configuration only from the travel-samples bucket: ./backup create --dir /tmp/backups --name=travel --include-buckets=travel-sample

To create a backup repository named travel in the /tmp/backups folder with a configuration that backs up all indexes and bucket configuration only from the travel-samples bucket: ./backup create --dir /tmp/backups --name=travel --include-buckets=travel-sample --disable-data

To create a backup repository named travel in the /tmp/backups folder with a configuration that backs up all data, GSI indexes, and full text indexes from all buckets: ./backup create --dir /tmp/backups --name=travel --disable-bucket-config --disable-views
